alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 29 at 10:53AM CDT until June 29 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Hancock County in west central Illinois... Southeastern Warren County in west central Illinois... Northern McDonough County in west central Illinois... * Until 1130 AM CDT. * At 1053 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Fountain Green, or 10 miles northeast of Carthage, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Colchester and Argyle Lake State Park around 1100 AM CDT. Macomb, Good Hope, Sciota, Western Illinois University, Spring Lake and McDonough County 4-H Grounds around 1105 AM CDT. Bardolph, Scottsburg, Macomb Municipal Airport, Youngstown and Swan Creek around 1110 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Bushnell, Little Swan Lake, New Philadelphia, Walnut Grove, Prairie City Airport and Prairie City. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
